title: What is the best site for free online courses? - Quora

response.answer_text: Massive Online Open Courses These are websites that offer a wide variety of courses generally provided by legitimate universities. Most sites have a majority of free courses with an option to pay a small fee to receive a certificate including a grade upon completion of the course. Some have courses that cost money to join. The classes may be work at your own pace and start whenever you like, or start on a particular date and require you to follow along and learn and complete work each week. Not only do you have access to the material, but also you can communicate with other students and the teacher. https://www.coursera.org/ – Coursera was the first of these sites that I found, and still my favorite. Offers nearly 2,000 courses with 147 partners, it truly provides a massive amount of information to its users. The majority of classes are free to take or at least audit, with the ability to receive a certificate upon completion for a nominal fee. Classes start on a specific date with assignments usually due each week. https://www.edx.org/ – Another major player in the field. Over 1,000 courses from 90 partners. Majority of courses are free with a paid option for a certificate. Some specialized course series must be paid for. https://www.udemy.com/ – Courses can be offered by anyone. A larger amount of courses on this site must be paid for but it still includes many free sites https://www.udacity.com/ – The courses primarily focus on computer programming and web development https://www.futurelearn.com/ – Universities are primarily based in the UK Open courseware There are several top universities that offer a small number of classes for free online in the form of video lectures of the actual classes. Quiz and test material are not available but it still offers very in depth knowledge Yale – http://oyc.yale.edu/ Stanford – http://online.stanford.edu/ MIT – https://ocw.mit.edu/index.htm Additional Sites https://www.khanacademy.org/ – Another favorite of mine. Everything is completely free with no ads; the site runs on donations. Videos started off covering just math and science but have since branched out into a wide variety of categories. Some even help tutor exams such as the SAT, LSAT, and MCAT. Similar to massive open online courses in its span. http://patrickjmt.com/ – Over a thousand free math videos from basic to high level math. https://www.codecademy.com/ – Learn how to code for free https://www.freecodecamp.com/ https://www.ted.com/ – Thousands of fascinating lectures. They won’t teach you skills like other websites listed here, but they are still very interesting. http://www.wolframalpha.com/ – A computational knowledge engine. Kind of like a search engine for calculations and information. A massive amount of information. Really interesting what you can find on here. https://www.gutenberg.org/ – Primarily free e-books https://librivox.org/ – Free Audiobooks https://www.memrise.com/ – Flashcards that are designed to help you to better learn topics. Language https://www.duolingo.com/ – Simple easy to use website and app that teaches dozens of languages. Makes learning the language fun and addictive. Mostly free with a few minor additional paid features http://www.lang-8.com/ – Offers the main services for free with upgrades to premium. The internet has opened us up to the acquisition of knowledge and skill like never before. Take advantage of that as much as possible. I write on Post Grad Survival Guide about business, investing, job hunting, productivity, personal development and other skills and knowledge that recent graduates should learn to make it in the real world.

There are various opportunities online to learn something new and upskill yourself. And the best part is that you don’t even need to pay any fees, these courses are absolutely free. Some free courses will provide even certificates after completion of the course.  Nowadays you almost learn any new skills online whether it may be playing guitar or learning English or learning art or craft. So here I’m pitching some best sites where you can get so many useful free online courses. Best and Free Online Courses- 1. Harvard University Free Online Courses Well, we all know how famous is this Harvard University. And you can explore a lot of free online courses. You can check the official website. There are different types of an online course and that too for FREE. 2.Google’s Digital Marketing Course (with certificate) Nowadays digital marketing has so much earning potential. And it is a skill that will help you a lot. And most importantly this course is absolutely free from Google itself. So complete this course and get a certificate also. Here you will learn the basics of digital marketing. So if you are interested then you can learn the basics without any fees. 3. CourseEra Free Online Courses CourseEra is also very popular. You will get so many varieties of online courses here. You may want to learn English grammar or any other things there are a lot of free courses. Don’t ever underestimate these free online courses because you will get these courses from top university faculties. 4. Udemy Free Online Courses Udemy is the best platform for all the people who want to learn and who want to teach something. You can get many free courses here. Also if you are interested in teaching something then you can even create an education course and sell to make some good money. 5. Alison Free Online Courses Around 17 million people have joined various courses on Alison. So you can also look for free courses on this website. There are so many courses there like - customer service skill course and much more. I can say you will get all most all types of courses. So you can check out all these sites to learn new skills. No matter which skill you learn, every skill will empower you in one or the other way. And here you don’t even need to invest any money. So just fix some hours or even just 30 minutes per day to learn something new from these websites for free. And you can also be part of my Quora community to learn about money tips and personal finance. This is also absolutely free :) We are a strong community with 2k+ members.
